author: b.hartnett
content: Will bal-devnet-2 include the changes to move the BAL out of the block body? And if so will we have a new EEST test release for this?

author: b.hartnett
content: After moving the BAL out of the block body, how will syncing over devp2p work? Will we need to define new message types in the eth protocol to support transfering BAL since they will no longer be included in the block body?

author: jwasinger
content: I believe devnet 2 does include this change.

author: jwasinger
content: we only really need a new access-list request/send set of p2p messages so that it can be used for snap sync.  AFAIK the CL will provide the BALs at/near the chain tip via FCU and clients that want to check the validity of past segments of the chain can recompute the BALs locally and check that the computed hash matches what's reported in the block.

author: m0_ox
content: Yes, these changes were in. Release [v3.0.0](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/releases/tag/bal%40v3.0.0) was just released.
